results.title: The Bradman era
results.creator_credit: Albie Thoms, ABC Video and Jack Egan
results.brief_description: This film, a companion to the book, traces the career of Sir Donald Bradman from the early 1930s through until 1948 when he led an undefeated Australian team in England in his last test series. The film also contains coverage of many of the controversial incidents during the “Bodyline” series in 1932-33 and shows the great players in action. Rated: G

results.title: The Battle for Bowen Hills
results.creator_credit: Garry Lane, Peter Gray and Crowsfoot Films
results.brief_description: The story of Brisbane working class residents’ protracted struggle to defend their homes against the inner city freeway proposals of the Queensland Government. This film was made for community groups under a similar threat and for those interested in multinational development and the political economy of transport. Narrated by Geraldine Willisee. (Also includes ex-Queensland Senator Russ Hinze).

results.title: A Phoenix rising
results.brief_description: A documentary film showing how the community of Mt. Macedon is piecing together its life again after being annihilated by the fires of Ash Wednesday. The film is based on interviews with some of the residents and gives case studies of a couple of families. Written and narrated by John Bonney.

results.title: Tandberg on page one
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Education Dept. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Ron Tandberg is Australia’s best known political cartoonist. This film follows through Tandberg’s work on the front page of the Melbourne ‘Age’ on one particular night’s edition. This document is significant for its depiction of the production of a broadsheet newspaper (including it printing) in 1983 and the dramatic change in production since computerisation was introduced shortly afterwards.

results.title: Marathon I
results.creator_credit: Tim Kupsch and John Blackett-Smith Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at the individual training strategies and motivation of top world marathon runner Robert de Castella of Australia and Alberto Salazar of the USA. Follows each of them as they fight it out in the 1982 Rotterdam marathon, highlighting the incredible winning performance by de Castella, who after having run twenty-five miles at a rate of five minutes per mile, covered the last mile in a staggering four minutes and thirty-two seconds.

results.title: The Singer and the Dancer
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong and Australian Film Council
results.brief_description: Set in the country, an older woman relives the bitter memories of her past, through her friendship with a younger girl who is experiencing a very insecure relationship with her boyfriend. Winner of several awards including Australian Film Awards and Sydney Film Festival. Cast includes Ruth Cracknell, Elizabeth Crosby, Russell Keifel, Jude Kuring, Gerry Duggan, Julie Dawson, Jane Buckland, Kate Sheil, Rob Steele, Kerry Walker. Photographer: Russell Boyd. Based on a short story by Alan Marshall.

results.title: Media Education (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Children must learn to evaluate and understand the language of media forms. By actively participating in media studies classes, film making, role playing and newscasting, they learn to question what they see and read, and become more aware of good and bad production
